raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are extracting factual relations from a medical imaging lecture. Use only information grounded in the input SLIDE_TEXT.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
Now I’m going to show you some numerical examples at the end so you have a better understanding. 
These examples let you see how what we learned works on real cases. After that, we’ll take a quick look at a few clinical images.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Output a triple only if both subject and object appear verbatim in SLIDE_TEXT (case-insensitive).
- Predicates must be one of: uses | via | represents | depends_on | measures | produces | reconstructs_with.
- Add modalities ["text"] by default; add "image" only if clearly visible without the text.
- Confidence in [0,1].

OUTPUT:
{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"<verbatim subject>", "p":"uses|via|represents|depends_on|measures|produces|reconstructs_with",
     "o":"<verbatim object>", "modalities":["text","image"], "confidence":0.0, "evidence":"<short quote from SLIDE_TEXT>"}
  ]
}

assistant
{
  "triples": [
    {
      "s": "Numerical Examples",
      "p": "represents",
      "o": "real cases",
      "modalities": [
        "text"
      ],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "These examples let you see how what we learned works on real cases."
    },
    {
      "s": "Clinical Images",
      "p": "represents",
      "o": "real cases",
      "modalities": [
        "text"
      ],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "After that, we’ll take a quick look at a few clinical images."
    }
  ]
}

triples.evidence: These examples let you see how what we learned works on real cases.
After that, we'll take a quick look at a few clinical images.
